alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Broome and southeastern Tioga Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Owego, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Vestal, Johnson City, Endicott, Maine, Owego, Port Dickinson, Newark Valley, Greater Binghamton Airport and Apalachin. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 3 and 7. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 64 and 72. Interstate 88 between 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York.
